title:
A class of Parameterized Shift-Splitting Preconditioners for Regularized
  Three-by-Three Block Saddle Point Problems
authors: Sk. Safique Ahmad and Pinki Khatun
abstract:
In this paper, we propose a parameterized shift-splitting (PSS)
preconditioner, along with its two relaxed variants to solve the regularized
three-by-three block saddle point problem (RTBSPP). The convergence of the
associated PSS iteration method is analyzed, and sufficient conditions on the
parameters for convergence are established. Spectral analyses are performed to
derive sharp bounds for the eigenvalues of the preconditioned matrices.
Numerical experiments based on examples arising from the PDE-constrained
optimization problems are performed to demonstrate the effectiveness and
robustness of the proposed preconditioners compared with existing
state-of-the-art preconditioners.
